body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } Indictment for grand Larceny
Benjamin Singleton Defendant
At a Circuit Court held for Henderson County. Kentucky, on the 18th day of December 1862.

"The defendant appeared in discharge of his recognisance bond, The Commonlth by her attorney appeared; & the defendant filed a plea of not guilty to the charge &c and thereupon came a Jury viz. Wm J Marshall. A F. Parker, J. B. Clay. J H Lambert. A S Jones, Wm A McClanahan. Leonard Bentley, W B. Smith, D N Walden, Royal Utley, R H. Agnew, and John Tuell, who being sworn, and not being able to conclude the evidence were permitted to disperse until tomorrow morning at 10 Oclock having first received a charge from the Court m --

And afterwards on the 19th of December 1862. "The defendant appeared in Court, and the Jury empannelled herein on a former day of this term appeared, and took their seats, & the argument of the counsel not being concluded were permitted to disperse until tomorrow. Morning 10 Oclock, under a charge from the Courtm

And afterwards on the 20th of December 1862:. "The Jury empannelled herein on a former day of this term appeared and took their seats; the argument of counsel being concluded, the Jury retired to their room and being unable to agree upon a verdict were discharged by the Court- Thereupon the defendant gave bond for his appearance in this Court on the 2d day of its next June term to answer the charge in the indictment in the sum of $500- with Milton Young security-

And afterwards on the 12th day of June 1863. "The plaintiff appeared by her attorney, and the defendant failing to appear in discharge of his bond, on motion of the Commonwealths attorney, the same is taken as forfeited, and a Summons this case is continued-"

The foregoing are true copies from the record.
attest Clerk H. C. CAdam Rankin

Henderson Aug 17 1863
To His Excellency
J F Robinson. Gov of Ky.
Sir

We the undersigned were members of the Jury that tried Benj Singleton in Henderson Cir Court for Grand Larceny, & state that a majority of sd jury were in favor of his acquittal -- We join in the request that the amount of the forfeited bond, signed by Milton Young decd. be remitted by your excellency

Very Respectfully
Wm J Marshall
Alvan. L. Jones
D. N. Walden
present Sheriff of Henderson County
John Tuell
The forfeiture in this case is remitted

J F Robinson
M. Young
Issd Aug 21, 1863.
